page.title: 02FARMING IN GOXHILL.
page.content: The area is very flat. To the north of the village, towards the Humber bank is the area known as the Marsh. All of the roads in this area are straight, a legacy of the 18th century enclosures. The land is mainly used for arable farming with{cereals}as the main crop. Root crops are extensively grown, particularly{sugar beet.}The yellow {oil seed rape}flower is now a feature of the area each spring.{Peas,}which were grown for the Grimsby frozen food industry have declined as a major crop due to closure of a deep freeze factory there. Some are grown and frozen at factories in Hull but most are now dried for human consumption or fed to livestock as a source of protein.{Beans}are also grown. A small amount are frozen at Grimsby but most are dried for human and animal consumption.
